ibis.ipl

Interface Registry

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Manageable

    public interface Registry
extends Manageable
    A Registry coordinates the Pool which an Ibis instance is part of.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • elect

        IbisIdentifier elect(java.lang.String electionName)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Elects a single candidate from a number of candidates calling this method with a specified election name. Note that this has nothing to do with a real election: it is not like "most votes count". It is more like: "the first one in gets it".

        When it is detected the winner of the election has left or has died a new winner will automatically be elected and returned on the next call of this function.

        Parameters:
        electionName - the name of this election.
        Returns:
        the Ibis identifier of the elected Ibis instance.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown in case of trouble.

      • elect

        IbisIdentifier elect(java.lang.String electionName,
                     long timeoutMillis)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Elects a single candidate from a number of candidates calling this method with a specified election name. Note that this has nothing to do with a real election: it is not like "most votes count". It is more like: "the first one in gets it".

        When it is detected the winner of the election has left or has died a new winner will automatically be elected and returned on the next call of this function.

        Blocks for at most the specified timeout. If no winner can be determined by then, null is returned.

        Parameters:
        electionName - the name of this election.
        timeoutMillis - time to wait. 0 means: wait forever.
        Returns:
        the Ibis identifier of the elected Ibis instance.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown in case of trouble.

      • getElectionResult

        IbisIdentifier getElectionResult(java.lang.String electionName)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Gets the result of an election, without being a candidate. Blocks until there is a winner for the election.
        Parameters:
        electionName - the name of this election.
        Returns:
        the Ibis identifier of the elected Ibis instance.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown in case of trouble.

      • getElectionResult

        IbisIdentifier getElectionResult(java.lang.String electionName,
                                 long timeoutMillis)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Gets the result of an election, without being a candidate. Blocks for at most the specified timeout. If there is no winner by then, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        electionName - the name of this election.
        timeoutMillis - time to wait. 0 means: wait forever, -1 means: return immediately.
        Returns:
        the Ibis identifier of the elected Ibis instance.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown in case of trouble.

      • maybeDead

        void maybeDead(IbisIdentifier ibisIdentifier)
        throws java.io.IOException
        Should be called when an application suspects that a particular Ibis instance is dead. The registry may react by checking this.
        Parameters:
        ibisIdentifier - the Ibis identifier of the Ibis instance suspected to be dead.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown in case of trouble.

      • assumeDead

        void assumeDead(IbisIdentifier ibisIdentifier)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Instructs the registry to assume that the specified Ibis instance is dead.
        Parameters:
        ibisIdentifier - the Ibis identifier of the Ibis instance that must be assumed to be dead.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown in case of trouble.

      • signal

        void signal(java.lang.String signal,
            IbisIdentifier... ibisIdentifiers)
     throws java.io.IOException
        Send a signal to one or more Ibis instances. This results in a RegistryEventHandler.gotSignal(String,IbisIdentifier) upcall on all Ibis instances in the given list. It is up to the application to react accordingly.
        Parameters:
        signal - the value of the signal. Useful if more than one type of signal is needed.
        ibisIdentifiers - the ibis instances to which the signal is to be sent.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown in case of trouble.

      • joinedIbises

        IbisIdentifier[] joinedIbises()
        Returns the Ibis instances that joined the pool. Returns the changes since the last joinedIbises call, or, if this is the first call, all Ibis instances that joined. This call only works if this Ibis is configured to support registry downcalls. That is, no RegistryEventHandler is used and either IbisCapabilities.MEMBERSHIP_UNRELIABLE or IbisCapabilities.MEMBERSHIP_TOTALLY_ORDERED have been requested. If no Ibis instances joined, an array with 0 entries is returned.
        Returns:
        the joined Ibises.
        Throws:
        IbisConfigurationException - is thrown when the port was not configured to support membership administration.

      • leftIbises

        IbisIdentifier[] leftIbises()
        Returns the Ibis instances that left the pool. Returns the changes since the last leftIbises call, or, if this is the first call, all Ibis instances that left. This call only works if this Ibis is configured to support registry downcalls. That is, no RegistryEventHandler is used and either IbisCapabilities.MEMBERSHIP_UNRELIABLE or IbisCapabilities.MEMBERSHIP_TOTALLY_ORDERED have been requested. If no Ibis instances left, an array with 0 entries is returned.
        Returns:
        the left Ibises.
        Throws:
        IbisConfigurationException - is thrown when ibis was not configured to support membership administration.

      • diedIbises

        IbisIdentifier[] diedIbises()
        Returns the Ibis instances that died. Returns the changes since the last diedIbises call, or, if this is the first call, all Ibis instances that died. This call only works if this Ibis is configured to support registry downcalls. That is, no RegistryEventHandler is used and either IbisCapabilities.MEMBERSHIP_UNRELIABLE or IbisCapabilities.MEMBERSHIP_TOTALLY_ORDERED have been requested. If no Ibis instances died, an array with 0 entries is returned.
        Returns:
        the Ibises that died.
        Throws:
        IbisConfigurationException - is thrown when ibis was not configured to support membership administration.

      • receivedSignals

        java.lang.String[] receivedSignals()
        Returns the signals received. Returns the changes since the last receivedSignals call, or, if this is the first call, all signals received so far. This call only works if this Ibis is configured to support registry downcalls. That is, no RegistryEventHandler is used and IbisCapabilities.SIGNALS has been requested. If no signals were received, an array with 0 entries is returned.
        Returns:
        the received signals.
        Throws:
        IbisConfigurationException - is thrown when ibis was not configured to support signals.

      • getPoolSize

        int getPoolSize()
        When running closed-world, returns the total number of Ibis instances in the pool.
        Returns:
        the number of Ibis instances
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - is thrown when the property ibis.pool.total_hosts is not defined or does not represent a number.
        IbisConfigurationException - is thrown when this is not a closed-world run.

      • getPoolName

        java.lang.String getPoolName()
        Returns the name of the pool this ibis is a member of.
        Returns:
        the name of the pool

      • waitUntilPoolClosed

        void waitUntilPoolClosed()
        When running closed-world, wait for the pool to close. A pool closes after all Ibisses have joined.
        Throws:
        IbisConfigurationException - is thrown when this is not a closed-world run, or when registry events are not enabled yet.

      • isClosed

        boolean isClosed()
        Returns if this pool has been closed.
        Returns:
        true if this pool is closed, false if not.

      • enableEvents

        void enableEvents()
        Allows reception of RegistryEventHandler upcalls. Registry events are saved until the event handler is enabled, and are then delivered, one by one. Ibis instances are always started with the registry event handler disabled. This method must be called to allow for the reception of registry handler upcalls.

      • disableEvents

        void disableEvents()
        Disables reception of RegistryEventHandler upcalls. Registry events will be saved until the handler is enabled again, and then be delivered, one by one.

      • getSequenceNumber

        long getSequenceNumber(java.lang.String name)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Obtains a sequence number from the registry. Each sequencer has a name, which must be provided to this call.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of this sequencer.
        Returns:
        the sequence number
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - may be thrown when communication with the registry fails.

      • addTokens

        void addTokens(java.lang.String name,
               int count)
        throws java.io.IOException
        Add a number of tokens to the registry.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the token
        count - the number of tokens
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - may be thrown when communication with the registry fails.

      • getToken

        java.lang.String getToken(java.lang.String name)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Gets and subtracts a token from the registry. If it is not available, NULL is returned.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the token
        Returns:
        the name of the token, or NULL if it is not available
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - may be thrown when communication with the registry fails.

      • terminate

        void terminate()
        throws java.io.IOException
        Send a termination event to all members of the pool, including this Ibis. Also closes the pool, if it has not been closed yet, stopping any new ibisses from joining the pool. Depending on the registry implementation, there may be a delay between this function being called, and the event arriving at all ibisses (including this one)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - may be thrown when communication with the registry fails.
        IbisConfigurationException - is thrown when ibis was not configured to support termination.

      • hasTerminated

        boolean hasTerminated()
        Returns if this pool has been terminated.
        Returns:
        true if this pool has terminated, false if not.
        Throws:
        IbisConfigurationException - is thrown when ibis was not configured to support termination.

      • waitUntilTerminated

        IbisIdentifier waitUntilTerminated()
        Waits until this pool has been terminated.
        Returns:
        The ibis which terminated the pool.
        Throws:
        IbisConfigurationException - is thrown when ibis was not configured to support termination.
